author: Staff Reporter
text:
Shutterbugs will not just capture the picturesque Puducherry this year, but also spread the message of water conservation during the PondyPHOTO 2016. The theme of the annual photo exhibition, which will be held from August 27 to September 11, is ‘water.’ The event is being organised by PondyART, Pondicherry Science Forum, French Institute of Pondicherry, Toxics Link and Heritage Commons.

As a pre-event, a Vintage Photography Workshop, beginning Thursday will shed light on the history and evolution of photography. The three-day workshop at the French Institute of Pondicherry will discuss Cyanotype print, egg albumen print and salt print processes.

Renowned photo historian Aditya Arya will conduct the workshop. He will teach the participants how to mix light-sensitive chemistry, show them how to sensitise, expose and process images. In addition to this, the participants will also have an opportunity to make vintage prints’ negatives.

On Friday, Ingela Ihrman, a visual artist based in Sweden will make a presentation on Temporality in the Intertidal: The Practice of Perspective.

Kasha Vande, creative director, PondyArt said: “The PondyPHOTO is organised to make art available to everyone. During this festival, the auto-rickshaws will set art in motion. The workshop is being organised as a pre-event to the exhibition.” Photographs taken during this workshop will be presented at the PondyPHOTO 2016.

Themed water, the exhibition will showcase works of internationally-renowned photographers and emerging photographers. The workshop and presentation series will end on Saturday night with a jazz performance on Pondy Night Out Live Music Series at Kasha-Ki-Asha Art Café and Boutique.
title: Workshop to shed light on vintage photography
